attributes.action: Make it unlawful for ANY member of parliament not to give a direct answer to ANY question put in the house
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Although I apreciate that it is sometimes needed for a politician to flesh out an answer to a question set in the house, I and many others very rarely hear a direct answer to a direct question.
As we the public pay the wages & vote for the members, It should be unlawful for any member, no matter what his or her post to not directly answer a question. 
I am not wanting all answers to be yes or no, but this should be contained in the answer if the question was clear.
How can it be outside of the remit of the prime minister & government to pass a law?

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
